result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Disposition Form
Def appeared in person.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (15CM94)  State recommend case be dismissed for read-in upon plea to 15CM94.  Court dismissed case upon plea to 15CM94.
Letter received from Defendant
$150 cash bond previously signed Continued (remains in effect) - same conditions

Def appears in person in custody.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant missed court as thought next court date was February and was at work and just over looked court date and apologizes and was notified by a friend that there was a warrant and then turned himself in.  State makes statements.  Court admonishes defendant on missed court appearance.  Defendant assures will return to court.  Court reinstates cash bond but it was not forfeited so continued.
